meanings.definition: Vulgar or indecent in speech, language, etc.
meanings.sent1: The comedian's ribald jokes made some audience members uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The movie had a ribald sense of humor that appealed to a certain audience.
meanings.sent3: The ribald comments at the party caused a few raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: Her ribald language painted a vivid picture of her rough upbringing.
meanings.sent5: The ribald lyrics of the song stuck in my mind long after it ended.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or using coarse, indecent humor.
meanings.sent1: The ribald comedy show had the audience laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent2: His ribald sense of humor often got him into trouble at work.
meanings.sent3: The ribald jokes at the family dinner were met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent4: She had a ribald wit that could catch anyone off guard.
meanings.sent5: The ribald banter between the characters added a unique charm to the play.
